H.ref: Rita, which picked up strength and has turned into a Category-5 hurricane, could slam Texas by the weekend and bring floodwater to New Orleans, which was battered by Hurricane Katrina just over three weeks ago.

H.text: Hurricane Rita could reach top intensity before it hits land.
H.ref: Hurricane Rita, already an "extremely dangerous" storm continued to gain strength Wednesday and could reach top intensity before it hits land, probably in Texas, the US National Hurricane Center said.

Rita, which picked up strength and has turned into a Category-5 hurricane, could slam Texas by the weekend and bring floodwater to New Orleans, which was battered by Hurricane Katrina just over three weeks ago.
US President George W. Bush declared on Wednesday a state of emergency in Texas and Louisiana, at a time when both states were bracing for Hurricane Rita, the White House said.
Texas officials on Wednesday urged voluntary evacuations of residents from areas that could lie in the path of powerful Hurricane Rita as it churned ominously toward their state.

H.text: Hurricane Rita pounded the Florida Keys Islands.
H.ref: Oil prices were higher in Asian trade Wednesday as Hurricane Rita pounded the Florida Keys islands before barreling into the Gulf of Mexico where much of US production is sourced, dealers said.

H.text: Rita barreled toward the Gulf of Mexico.
H.ref: Oil prices were higher in Asian trade Wednesday as Hurricane Rita pounded the Florida Keys islands before barreling into the Gulf of Mexico where much of US production is sourced, dealers said.

H.text: A state of emergency was declared in Louisiana.
H.ref: US President George W. Bush declared on Wednesday a state of emergency in Texas and Louisiana, at a time when both states were bracing for Hurricane Rita, the White House said.
US President George W. Bush declared on Wednesday a state of emergency in Texas and Louisiana, at a time when both states were bracing for Hurricane Rita, the White House said.

In Louisiana, still recovering from Hurricane Katrina's August 29 hit, authorities were keeping a close eye on Rita, and New Orleans Mayor Ray Nagin suspended the return of the city's residents because of the new threat.

H.text: New Orleans was battered by Hurricane Katrina in August 2005.
H.ref: Rita, which picked up strength and has turned into a Category-5 hurricane, could slam Texas by the weekend and bring floodwater to New Orleans, which was battered by Hurricane Katrina just over three weeks ago.

H.text: Gulf of Mexico is rich in oil.
H.ref: US meteorologists on Wednesday upgraded Hurricane Rita, which roared into the oil-rich Gulf of Mexico after slamming Cuba and the Florida Keys islands, to a more powerful Category Three category on the five-level hurricane intensity scale.

H.text: Rita has turned into a Category-5 hurricane.
H.ref: Rita, which picked up strength and has turned into a Category-5 hurricane, could slam Texas by the weekend and bring floodwater to New Orleans, which was battered by Hurricane Katrina just over three weeks ago.

H.text: US President George W. Bush declared a state of emergency in Texas.
H.ref: US President George W. Bush declared on Wednesday a state of emergency in Texas and Louisiana, at a time when both states were bracing for Hurricane Rita, the White House said.

US meteorologists on Wednesday upgraded Hurricane Rita, which roared into the oil-rich Gulf of Mexico after slamming Cuba and the Florida Keys islands, to a more powerful Category Three category on the five-level hurricane intensity scale.

H.text: Hurricane warnings were in effect around Havana.
H.ref: Hurricane warnings were in effect around Havana and western provinces.

H.text: Royal Dutch Shell has removed some 545 staff from its platforms.
H.ref: Anglo-Dutch energy giant Royal Dutch Shell has meanwhile removed some 545 staff from its platforms since Sunday.

H.text: More than 70 percent of US oil production in the Gulf of Mexico has been shut down because of the threat of Hurricane Rita.
H.ref: More than 70 percent of US oil production in the Gulf of Mexico has been shut down because of the threat of Hurricane Rita and the aftermath of Katrina, authorities reported Wednesday.

H.text: Oil prices were higher in Asian trade.
H.ref: Oil prices were higher in Asian trade Wednesday as Hurricane Rita pounded the Florida Keys islands before barreling into the Gulf of Mexico where much of US production is sourced, dealers said.
